thread.title: FOOTBALL: Epperson leads San Bernardino Valley to victory
thread.title_full: FOOTBALL: Epperson leads San Bernardino Valley to victory - Press Enterprise

author: The Press-Enterprise
title: FOOTBALL: Epperson leads San Bernardino Valley to victory
text:
Published: Oct. 17, 2015 Updated: Oct. 18, 2015 12:02 a.m. Daniel Epperson threw for three touchdowns and completed 20 of 30 passes for 315 yards to help the San Bernardino Valley football team edge Victor Valley College, 28-27, in a Foothill Athletic Conference at home on Saturday.
Mason Rutherford opened the scoring for Redlands in the first quarter with a 53-yard touchdown. He finished the night with 204 receiving yards and scored two touchdowns.
SBVC (5-1) trailed 14-13 going into the fourth quarter, before Deion Walker rushed for 2 yards and score a touchdown.
Epperson completed a pass to Samuel Dominguez for a 4-yard touchdown to make it 28-21.
Victor Valley’s (5-1) Tyler Hatch caught a 27-yard pass from Sam Allen to cut the lead 28-27, after the Wolverines blocked the kick attempt from James Liker.
Walker finished with 125 rushing yards.
Claremont-Mudd-Scripps 25, Redlands 23: The Bulldogs led 21-19 in the fourth quarter, but could not hold on as the host Stags came away with a late-game drive to win the game.
CMS (3-2) opened the scoring with a 24-yard field goal before quarterback Kevin Russell fired off five passes on a seven-play drive for a Bulldog (2-3, 2-1 in SCIAC) touchdown.
Devin Appleton had a 29-yard carry to give Redlands a 14-10 lead in the second quarter.
The Stags managed to get another field goal before the half to cut the deficit to one.
After CMS scored a touchdown with 12:57 left in the final quarter, the Bulldogs gained the ball on two more possessions, one of which came off of an interception. However, Redlands struggled to move the ball and was forced to punt, allowing the Stags to find the end zone for the winning score.
The win is CMS’ first over Redlands since 2003.
MSJC 42, San Diego Mesa 13: Jake Newton threw for five touchdowns in the Eagles’ rout of the Olyimpians at home.
With the win, MSJC improves 3-3 in CCCAA play while San Diego Mesa falls to 2-4.
